content: Christopher Godbout is a professor of mathematics at San Diego City College.

title: Math 59

content:
I’ve created an excel workbook to help with calculations. I will be updating it as needed throughout the semester. It’s available in 3 formats:
  Click here to download xlsx (for Microsoft Excel).   Click here to download ods (LibreOffice or OpenOffice).   Click here to access the document on Google Drive.   I’ve also created a program for the TI Calculator that will calculate the expected numbers for the \(\chi^2\) test for independence / homogeneity. You can download it here. Or you can code it yourself. The code is as follows:
: dim([A])→L₆ : L₆(1)→R : L₆(2)→C : Matr▶list(cumSum([A])ᵀ,R,L₆ : sum(L₆)→T : {R,C}→dim([B] : For(I,1,R) : For(J,1,C) : Matr▶list([A]ᵀ,I,L₆ : Matr▶list([A],J,L₅ : sum(L₅)*sum(L₆)/T → [B](I,J) : End : End I’m also redoing some of the Statway online tools to make them (IMHO) better. So far I have:
  M&M Proportion Simulator   Normal Distribution Calculator   Student T Distribution Calculator
summary:
I’ve created an excel workbook to help with calculations. I will be updating it as needed throughout the semester. It’s available in 3 formats:
  Click here to download xlsx (for Microsoft Excel).   Click here to download ods (LibreOffice or OpenOffice).   Click here to access the document on Google Drive.   I’ve also created a program for the TI Calculator that will calculate the expected numbers for the \(\chi^2\) test for independence / homogeneity.
title: Statway

content:
Sample Exams   Slides   All of my slides are made using org-mode and then exporting to various formats.
Sample Exams   Sample Exam 1   Slides These slides go along with the Hawkes Learning textbook, Beginning Statistics by Warren et al.
  Section 2.1: Frequency Distributions ( 4:3 format )  Section 2.2: Graphical Displays of Data   Section 2.3: Analyzing Graphs ( 4:3 format )  Section 3.1: Measures of Center ( 4:3 format )  Section 3.2: Measures of Dispersion ( 4:3 format )  Section 3.3: Measures of Relative Position ( 4:3 format )  Section 4.1: Introduction to Probability ( 4:3 format )  Section 4.2: Addition Rule for Probability ( 4:3 format )  Section 4.3: Multiplication Rule for Probability ( 4:3 format )  Section 4.4: Combinations and Permutations ( 4:3 format )  Section 4.5: Combining Combinations and Probability   Section 5.1: Discrete Random Variables ( 4:3 format )  Section 5.2: Binomial Distribution ( 4:3 format )  Section 5.3: Poisson Distribution ( 4:3 format )  Section 6.2: The Standard Normal Distribution ( 4:3 format )  Section 6.3: Probability Using Normal Distributions ( 4:3 format )  Section 6.4: Finding Values of a Normally Distributed Random Variable ( 4:3 format )  Section 6.5: Approximation of a Binomial Distribution Using a Normal Distribution ( 4:3 format )  Section 7.1: Introduction to the Central Limit Theorem ( 4:3 format )  Section 7.2: Central Limit Theorem and Means ( 4:3 format )  Section 8.4: Estimating Population Proportions   Sections 8.1, 8.2, and 8.3: Estimating Population Means   Section 9.2: Comparing Two Population Means   Section 9.4: Comparing Two Population Proportions   Section 10.1: Fundamentals of Hypothesis Testing   Section 10.3: Hypothesis Test for a Population Means   Section 10.4: Hypothesis Test for a Population Proportion   Sections 12.1: Scatterplots and Correlation   Sections 12.2: Linear Regression
